title: Dugong redux

content: A tragic stampede at actor-politician Vijay‚Äôs rally in Karur claimed at least 36 lives, including women and children, and left over 50 injured. The overcrowded event was part of Vijay‚Äôs state-wide tour. CM M.K. Stalin called the incident deeply concerning, ordered emergency response, and announced ‚Çπ10 lakh compensation for the victims‚Äô families.

content: The organisers had announced that TVK president Vijay would speak at 12 p.m.; the crowd began to assemble from 9 a.m., but he did not arrive at the scheduled time.

title: Govt. grants administrative sanction for construction of stretch between HMT, NAD
content: A review meeting convened by Industries Minister P. Rajeeve resolved to initiate tender formalities promptly upon receipt of technical sanction

content: Minor Irrigation dept. is mulling over the possibility of using precast concrete structures to restore the 200-metre stretch between Chittoor Road and M.G. Road under ‚ÄòOperation Breakthrough‚Äô

title: Encroachments demolished to complete new bridge across Kamadalam river near Arani
content: Officials of State Highways, which is constructing the bridge, said that most of the encroachments are houses and petty shops, which were built more than two decades ago.

title: Officials yet to give a copy of detention order, no contact with Sonam Wangchuk, says his wife
content: Gitanjali Angmo says she will move court in a day if there is no information on the activist; two Congress councillors and several youth leaders surrender in court today

content: Naidu releases Tourism Policy Operational Guidelines and launches ‚ÄòAP Tourism Homestay Portal‚Äô; government is eyeing tourism growth rate of 20%

content: As a practice, election dates are announced after the visit of the full ECI to a State; likely to be announced any time after October 5

title: Musi in spate: A flood to remember¬†¬†
content: ‚ÄòCurrent flood inflow to Osman Sagar and Himayatsagar matches levels last observed in 1962 and 1965‚Äô¬†

title: CM Siddaramaiah pulls up civic officials over potholes and poor waste management
content: With potholes multiplying during the monsoon, the Chief Minister gave civic agencies a one-month deadline to repair roads and make them motorable

title: Maulana forgot whose government is in Uttar Pradesh, will teach a lesson generations will forget to riot, says Adityanath
content: A day after a demonstration on a cleric‚Äôs call took a violent turn leading to clashes with the police, the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister says ‚Äúfor such anti-social elements‚Äù who were getting a free run, ‚Äúwe have brought in the bulldozer‚Äù. He says since 2017, his government has dealt firmly with rioters, responding in ways they understand.

title: Media conference begins on Monday
content: CM to open International Media Festival of Kerala in State capital on Tuesday; Palestine solidarity conference to be held on Monday

title: Musi river in spate leaves behind a trail of destruction
content: Water enters 200-300 houses, and many are completely submerged. Many residents say they were not alerted about water release from two reservoirs. In the city‚Äôs main bus station, about 2,000 passengers were evacuated using ropes.¬†

title: Holiday exodus adds to Bengaluru‚Äôs weekend snarls; commuters lament hour-long delays
content: The Central Business District and shopping hubs in the city centre were the worst affected, as traffic crawled along stretches such as M.G. Road, Brigade Road, Residency Road, Avenue Road, S.P. Road, and B.V.K. Iyengar Road

title: Karnataka Minister visits flood-hit Ganagapur, Sonna
content: Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister and Kalaburagi district In charge Priyank Kharge on Friday visited Ganagapur, Sonna, and other areas that were hit by floods as a large volume of water has been released into the Bhima from Maharashtra‚Äôs Veer, Ujani, and Seena reservoirs and Bori river, triggering fears of flooding

title: Opposition slams U.P. govt. over Bareilly violence, alleges bid to divide society
content: Congress leaders say police action over ‚ÄòI Love Muhammad‚Äô posters reflects strategy to cover failures and polarise communities

title: India will reject China‚Äôs ‚Äòarrogance of power‚Äô, Manmohan Singh wrote in one of his last essays
content: The late former Prime Minister advised reassessment of India-China ties after 2020 Galwan clashes but urged India to expand trade ties with Asian neighbours, including China

title: Govt. college students boycott classes in Dharwad
content: Citing lack of adequate number of guest lecturers, students of Government First Grade College and Government First Grade College for Women boycotted clasess in Dharwad on Saturday to register their protest.

title: Opposition seeks Wangchuk‚Äôs release; says govt. mishandled Ladakh crisis

content: At National Mediation Conference in Bhubaneswar, Chief Justice stresses collective efforts to make mediation integral to justice system

content: Statistics available with Forests department reveal that around one-third of the tourists who visit various scenic locations in Kerala flock to sensitive ecotourism centres, mostly situated in the hills in protected forests

content: Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao has said that the State government aims to ensure good health service to the people of Raichur district and to achieve that a mother and child hospital is now open and another 16 healthcare centres will soon be set up in the district

title: Students, MLAs urge ICAR to include agri school students in B.Sc. Agriculture admissions
content: ICAR chief says seven universities agree to review norms after complaints over exclusion despite CUET clearance

title: Watch: India‚Äôs diamond hub battles tariff hock, seeks government rescue | Pulse Maharashtra
content: In this week‚Äôs Pulse Maharashtra, Vinaya Deshpande Pandit reports on the growing crisis faced by thousands of artisans in Mumbai‚Äôs SEEPZ and Surat‚Äôs diamond polishing industry. With U.S. tariffs on gems and jewellery soaring to 50%, exports are stalling, risking billions in trade and nearly a million jobs. Industry leaders are urging the government for relief as workers brace for uncertain times ahead.

content: Under the scheme, eligible auto and cab drivers will be provided a financial assistance of ‚Çπ15,000 annually, the Chief Minister informs the Legislative Assembly, and asserts the double-engine government‚Äôs commitment to fulfil promises made in the manifesto

title: From tea factory to school: Munnar Government Vocational Higher Secondary School celebrates 100th year anniversary
content: The school was set up by Britishers in an old tea factory as a high school in 1926. The government took over the institution in 1955 and later upgraded it to a vocational higher secondary school

title: 17 remote villages of Chamarajanagar brought under 4G telecom network
content: ‚ÄòAuthorities have identified about 22 ‚Äònetwork shadow‚Äô villages in the district without any telecom services. title: State school arts festival in Thrissur will be a grand success, says Sivankutty¬†
content: Over 14,000 students from across the State will compete in 249 events across 26 venues from January 7 to January 11

title: Europe holds historic lead, on brink of Ryder Cup
content: Europe is on the verge of retaining the Ryder Cup after a dominant Saturday left it just 2.5 points from victory over the United States at Bethpage Black.

title: Bryson, Rose, caddies get heated at Bethpage
content: The caddies for Bryson DeChambeau and Scottie Scheffler were involved in a confrontation with Europe's Justin Rose and Tommy Fleetwood during their four-ball match Saturday.

title: Lynx rule star Collier out for must-win Game 4
content: The Lynx will be without their head coach and star player when they face elimination Sunday as Napheesa Collier has been ruled out with an ankle injury.

title: Lynx's Reeve suspended after blasting officiating
content: The WNBA suspended Lynx coach Cheryl Reeve for Sunday's Game 4 vs. the Mercury after her "conduct and comments" during and after Friday's Game 3 loss.

title: Tigers win, secure second straight playoff berth
content: Jahmai Jones hit a two-run single to rally the struggling Detroit Tigers from an early deficit, and his team hung on to defeat the Boston Red Sox 2-1 on Saturday, clinching a spot in the American League playoffs for the second straight season.

title: Fans target Rory, Lowry, who fire back with win
content: Rory McIlroy and Shane Lowry were heckled and yelled at repeatedly, in particular during their pre-shot routines or before they hit a putt, during Saturday afternoon play at the Ryder Cup.

title: Holmes' gem in must-win lifts Mets' playoff push
content: Clay Holmes delivered the best start of his career Saturday, keeping the Mets' playoff hopes afloat with six scoreless innings in a 5-0 win over the Marlins.

title: Source: Ducks give McTavish six-year, $42M deal
content: The Anaheim Ducks and restricted free agent center Mason McTavish, the 2021 third overall pick who is entering his fifth season, agreed to a six-year extension, the club announced on Saturday, and an NHL source told ESPN the deal is worth $42 million.

title: Elon Musk Says Epstein "Tried To Get Him To His Island", But He Refused
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk on Sunday said sex offender Jeffrey Epstein "tried to get" him to the US Virgin Islands - where many women said Epstein abused them - but he refused.

title: 39, Including Children, Killed In Stampede At Actor-Politician Vijay's Rally
content: A massive tragedy unfolded at Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur district, where 39 people, including nine children and 17 women were killed in a stampede.

title: On Camera, Moment Stampede Broke Out At Actor-Politician Vijay's Rally
content: Several videos taken at the site of actor-politician Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur showed the tragic moment when some people began to fall in the crowd before the situation developed into a stampede.

title: 3 Argentina Women Killed Live On Instagram By Drug Traffickers
content: The bodies of Morena Verdi and Brenda del Castillo, cousins aged 20, and 15-year-old Lara Gutierrez were found buried in a yard of a house in a southern suburb of Buenos Aires.

title: Delhi Baba Accused Of Molesting 17 Women At Ashram Arrested From Agra
content: Delhi Baba Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati faces complaints ranging from using abusive language, sending lewd text messages to women, and forced physical contact.

title: 'Deliberate Mobilisation Of Crowds': DMK's Big Charge At TVK Chief Vijay Over Stampede
content: The visuals of the parents mourning their children are "so so disturbing", said DMK spokesperson Saravanan Annadurai as 38 people were killed in a crowd crush at TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur district.

title: 'Such Practice Unacceptable': Madhya Pradesh Court Bans Burning Of Sonam Raghuvanshi Effigy On Dussehra
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court, on Saturday, ordered a ban on burning the effigies of accused Sonam Raghuvanshi and women from other states on Dussehra in Indore.

title: Canada Wants To Attract Tech Workers Who Won't Get US H-1B Visas
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney wants to attract employees from the technology sector who might have previously worked in the US before President Donald Trump's new visa charges.

title: "My Heart Is Shattered": TVK Chief Vijay's 1st Reaction After Stampede
content: In his first reaction hours after the stampede at his rally in which at least 38 people were killed, actor and Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) President Vijay has said his heart is "shattered" and he is "writhing" in pain.

title: Video: TVK Chief Vijay Tosses Water Bottles At Crowd Before Stampede That Killed 38
content: As the crowd swelled and people started getting suffocated because of the heat and overcrowding, actor and TVK President Vijay stopped his speech in Tamil Nadu's Karur and started tossing bottles of water at the crowd to help.

title: "Major Terror Attacks Traced Back To 1 Country": S Jaishankar Jabs Pak At UN
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar in a sharp attack at Pakistan, said that major international terrorist attacks are traced back to one country.

title: Home Ministry Seeks Report From Tamil Nadu Government Following Stampede
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday spoke with Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi and CM MK Stalin to take stock of the situation following a stampede in Karur and assured them of all possible central assistance to deal with the situation

title: "Deeply Saddening, Heartbreaking": Leaders Condemn Loss Of Lives In Tamil Nadu Stampede
content: President Droupadi Murmu has expressed deep anguish over the "loss of lives" in a stampede in Tamil Nadu. Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the news of the deaths was "deeply saddening."

title: At UN, Russian Foreign Minister Warns Of "Decisive Response" To Any "Aggression"
content: Russia's top diplomat on Saturday warned of a "decisive response" to any "aggression" after US President Donald Trump backed calls to shoot down Russian planes that violate NATO airspace.

title: West Bengal Social Media Influencer Arrested For Derogatory Remarks Against Indian Army
content: A social media influencer from Aranghata in West Bengal's Nadia district has been arrested for making highly derogatory comments about the Indian Armed Forces on social media, the police said on Saturday.

title: AFSPA Extended In Three Assam Districts For 6 More Months
content: The Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act or AFSPA was extended in three districts of Assam for six more months from October 1, according to a notification issued on Saturday.

title: India's Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve Gets UNESCO Tag, Now 13 Sites On List
content: India's Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve, perched high in the trans-Himalayan region, is among the 26 new biosphere reserves across several countries, designated by UNESCO, the world body announced on Saturday.

title: British Retailer Harrods Hit By Cyberattack, Warns Customers Of Data Breach
content: Harrods, the luxury British department store, has warned some customers that their personal data may have been taken in a breach of its online systems.

title: "Deeply Saddening": PM Modi Over Loss Of Lives At TVK Chief Vijay's Rally
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed deepest condolences on the lives lost in the stampede during TVK chief and actor Vijay's public rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur. He wished for the speedy recovery of people injured in the incident.

title: 'Standing here with deep sorrow': Tamil Nadu CM Stalin meets Karur stampede families; toll rises to 39
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin visited Karur following a stampede at a TVK campaign event, which tragically killed 39 people and injured many. He announced Rs 10 lakh compensation for the deceased and Rs 1 lakh for the injured. A retired High Court judge will head an inquiry commission into the incident.

title: Delhi 'godman' Swami Chaitanyananda, accused of molesting female students, arrested from Agra
content: Delhi Police arrested self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati in Agra, accused of sexually harassing 17 women students and orchestrating financial fraud. The 62-year-old allegedly exploited economically weaker students by seizing their phones and certificates, creating fear. His bail plea was rejected, with a court noting custodial interrogation is vital to unravel the extensive fraud and intimidation pattern.

title: For decades now, major international attacks traced to Pakistan: EAM Jaishankar
content: India's Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar warned the UN against nations sponsoring terror, implicitly calling Pakistan a global terrorism epicentre. India's representative further lambasted Pakistan, citing its history of sheltering terrorists and sponsoring groups like 'The Resistance Front' responsible for attacks. New Delhi asserted accountability for terrorists and their sponsors, rejecting third-party mediation.

title: Asia Cup: 'Jab tak jung hai tab tak cricket ki rivalry rahegi' - Former Pak captain
content: Rashid Latif reignited the India-Pakistan rivalry debate ahead of the Asia Cup final, saying it will never end ‚Äúas long as there is war.‚Äù While admitting India has the edge in skills, Latif stressed that the pressure will always be on India, who have ‚Äúeverything to lose,‚Äù while Pakistan, as underdogs, enter the contest with nothing to lose.

title: Army issues tender for highly mobile air defence system
content: India has initiated the acquisition process for three regiments of indigenous "Anant Shastra" Quick Reaction Surface-to-Air Missile systems, costing Rs 30,000 crore. These highly mobile systems, developed by DRDO, will detect and destroy aerial threats over 30km, providing crucial air defence cover for troops and replacing older systems, especially after recent border hostilities.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
content: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: AAP slams Rahul Gandhi's silence on activist's arrest, Congress hits back
content: Aam Aadmi Party and Congress engaged in a verbal spat. AAP questioned Rahul Gandhi's silence on Sonam Wangchuk's detention under NSA. Congress hit back, claiming AAP's foundation was RSS-backed and it seized power with false accusations. Meanwhile, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge condemned the Centre's handling of the situation. He demanded a judicial inquiry into police firing in Ladakh.

title: 75+ national Daughter's Day messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes for 2025
content: Daughter's Day, observed in India on September 28, 2025, celebrates the profound love and strength daughters bring to families. This special occasion originated to counter gender biases, advocating for equal rights, education, and opportunities for girls.

title: Asia Cup final: Why India need Bumrah smiling again vs Pakistan - Can he deliver?
content: Jasprit Bumrah enters the Asia Cup final against Pakistan under unusual scrutiny. Tasked with an exceptionally demanding role of bowling three overs in the powerplay, he has looked uncharacteristically off-colour, even losing his trademark calm. With five wickets in four games, India will hope their ‚Äúsmiling assassin‚Äù rediscovers his spark and delivers when it matters most.

title: Billionaire Silicon Valley investor says US' H-1B visa policy could backfire
content: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: ‚ÄòPutin visit planned‚Äô: Lavrov confirms December trip to New Delhi
content: Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov announced President Putin's December visit to New Delhi, emphasising extensive bilateral cooperation. Lavrov affirmed India's independent trade decisions with Russia, despite US sanctions, highlighting their "particularly privileged strategic partnership." He also reiterated Russia's strong support for India's permanent seat on the UN Security Council, advocating for global representation.

title: BJP objects to Kaaba song at Bengal pandal in CM Mamata Banerjee's presence
content: BJP strongly criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee after a song referencing Kaaba and Madinah was sung at a Durga pandal in her presence. The party labeled it "extremist and appeasement politics," questioning if it's part of the INDIA bloc's alleged agenda to "eradicate" Sanatan Dharma.

title: Top H‚Äë1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others; check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: Asia Cup: Abhishek Sharma's secret of success- 'Safal kyunki sabr bahut ae'
content: Abhishek Sharma‚Äôs rise has been forged by discipline, patience, and fearless hitting. Guided by mentor Yuvraj Singh‚Äôs gruelling 4 am routines and Brian Lara‚Äôs golf lessons, the young left-hander has transformed into a six-hitting machine. With 309 runs at a strike rate over 200 in the Asia Cup, he has become India‚Äôs most destructive batting force.

title: Amit Shah sets 160+ target for NDA in Bihar elections
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, during his Bihar visit, set an ambitious target of over 160 seats for BJP in the 2025 assembly elections. Addressing party workers, Shah urged them to publicize NDA's achievements and vowed to expel infiltrators.

title: 'They didn‚Äôt want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on film rejection
content: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: 'He stayed the same': Gisele B√ºndchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio
content: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

title: Tyson Fury‚Äôs daughter Venezuela, 16, engaged to boxer Noah Price
content: Tyson Fury's daughter, Venezuela Fury, got engaged. The 16-year-old accepted a proposal from boxer Noah Price. This event occurred at her 16th birthday party on September 26, 2025. Her mother, Paris Fury, confirmed the news on Instagram. Noah Price holds an East Midlands belt. The couple made their relationship public earlier this year.

title: Alex Ovechkin‚Äôs dating history: Inside the NHL star‚Äôs love life
content: Alex Ovechkin's romantic journey progressed from early relationships and a broken engagement with tennis star Maria Kirilenko. He ultimately found lasting love with Anastasia Shubskaya, whom he married in 2016. Together, they have two sons, and Anastasia actively supports his career, celebrating his record-breaking achievements and sharing their family life.

title: 'It comes back to bite': Jaishankar warns nations who condone terror; what he said at UN
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar vehemently criticized Pakistan at the UNGA, branding it the 'epicenter of terrorism.' He highlighted that major international terrorist attacks for decades have been traced back to that nation, with its nationals populating UN terror lists.

title: EC gears up for Bihar poll dates, announcement likely on October 6-7
content: The Election Commission is set to announce Bihar assembly poll dates soon after the final electoral roll publication on Sept 30. Key engagements include a meeting with observers on Oct 3 and a full commission visit to Bihar on Oct 4-5, with poll dates possibly declared by Oct 6 or 7.

title: Kim Kardashian hints at possibly owning a WNBA team in the near future
content: Kim Kardashian, the SKIMS owner, hinted at potentially owning a WNBA team, expressing her passion for empowering women in sports. She revealed her favorite team is the Las Vegas Aces, a choice that bypassed Caitlin Clark's Indiana Fever and sparked fan reactions. This highlights the significant impact of celebrity endorsements on the growing WNBA.

title: Draft bill to strengthen statistical institute unveiled
content: The central government has released a draft bill to significantly strengthen the Indian Statistical Institute. This legislation proposes a revamped, leaner governance structure and an empowered board, aiming to transform ISI into a world-leading institution by its 2031 centenary. The bill seeks to streamline decision-making and grant greater autonomy, ensuring world-class education and research.

title: HP cold desert now on Unesco's list of biosphere reserves
content: Unesco has designated India's Cold Desert Biosphere Reserve in the western Himalayas as part of its global network, making it the 13th Indian site. This 7,770 sq km reserve, established in 2009, is home to rare species like the snow leopard and is India's first high-altitude cold desert reserve, promoting sustainable living.

title: 'Swachh Shehar Jodi' launched to help 200 cities manage solid waste
content: The government launched the 'Swachh Shehar Jodi' programme to help 200 cities effectively manage municipal solid waste. This initiative pairs 72 mentor cities with 200 mentee cities, enabling them to learn and replicate best practices. Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal Khattar described it as a structured, outcome-driven mentorship for urban waste management.

title: Why are 5.3cr cases pending in Indian courts? Missing lawyers & witnesses, long stays...
content: The Supreme Court recently underscored speedy trial as an unimpeachable right amidst 5.34 crore pending cases nationwide. Key reasons for delays include unavailable counsels, absconding accused, and missing witnesses. The SC directed High Courts to ensure trials are not adjourned for counsel absence and proceed day-to-day, criticizing trial courts for flouting this mandate.

title: Two Bihar wetlands join global list of Ramsar sites
content: India has added two new wetlands in Bihar, Gokul Jalashay and Udaipur Jheel, to the global Ramsar list, increasing its total to 93 sites. This solidifies India's position as Asia's leader and third worldwide. These oxbow lakes support diverse biodiversity and local livelihoods, underscoring India's commitment to wetland conservation.

title: Ladakh unrest: Sonam Wangchuk arrest sparks outcry, police call firing ‚Äòself-defence‚Äô
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk was arrested and moved to Jodhpur jail. Police accused him of provocative remarks and alleged Pakistan links. This followed violent clashes in Leh where four people died and many were injured. Authorities relaxed curfew amid public outrage. Kargil Democratic Alliance and Leh Bar Association defended Wangchuk, rejecting police claims and demanding a judicial probe.

title: Kashmiri Pandit teacher left Valley in body, but never in spirit
content: Hirdey Nath Koul, beloved Kashmiri Pandit teacher and former Islamia High School principal, died at 93. Tributes highlighted his lifelong dedication to students and Kashmir, which he carried despite exile. The 1990s exodus shattered his heart, leaving him longing for his Srinagar home and cherished books until his final moments, embodying a poignant legacy.

title: Russia at UNGA: Lavrov pushes for permanent seat for India in UNSC - top quotes
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov backed a permanent United Nations Security Council seat for India. He spoke at the UNGA annual summit. Lavrov noted the world balance changed since the UN's start. Russia calls for Security Council reform by adding members from Asia, Africa, and Latin America. Russia supports India and Brazil for permanent council spots.

title: What is the 20-20-20 eye rule and how it can improve vision
content: Although the 20-20-20 rule may sound like a very simple practice, its benefits aren‚Äôt so simple. Over time, this routine can enhance focus and may even help slow the progression of myopia, especially in children. One can use their phones, laptops, smartwatches to give a ‚Äòstay-away‚Äô reminder every 20 minutes. Setting reminders makes the habit easier to maintain.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals her biggest fear after Dwyane Wade‚Äôs cancer diagnosis
content: Gabrielle Union revealed her biggest fear when Dwyane Wade was diagnosed with kidney cancer, admitting she worried about raising their children alone. His secrecy regarding his health decisions caused distrust, nearly bringing their marriage to rock bottom. Wade underwent surgery in December 2023 to remove 40% of his right kidney.

title: Stephen A Smith slams Trump for blaming Left in Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing
content: Stephen A. Smith strongly criticized Donald Trump for his "irresponsible" remarks following Charlie Kirk's murder, specifically Trump's quick blame of "the Left." Smith argued Trump's polarizing comments deepened national division and fear instead of uniting people after the tragic September 10, 2025, incident. This sparked wider debate on political speech.

title: On fire! Kohli's latest post gets over 5 million likes in just 2 hrs: What is it about?
content: Virat Kohli delighted fans by sharing an intimate new photograph with wife Anushka Sharma, quickly amassing over 5 million likes. The couple, recently seen in London with their son Akaay, continues to share glimpses of their family life. This follows Virat's heartfelt birthday tribute to Anushka in May, highlighting their enduring relationship since meeting in 2013.

title: US student loan forgiveness backlog hits 74k under Trump: Here's why it's growing so fast
content: A growing backlog of 74,510 US student loan forgiveness applications under the PSLF Buyback programme remains unresolved under President Trump‚Äôs administration. The initiative, designed to credit missed public service months due to forbearance or deferment, has faced significant delays, partly due to staffing cuts at the Education Department. Legal action by the American Federation of Teachers has forced data disclosure. Borrowers and advocates urge continued applications despite processing slowdowns and pending repayment plan requests exceeding one million.

title: TVK rally tragedy: Long delay, overcrowded - what we know so far
content: A tragic stampede-like situation at a TVK campaign rally in Karur resulted in the deaths of at least 31 people, including three children. Actor-turned-politician Vijay was campaigning when the overcrowded event turned chaotic, prompting his personal intervention. Chief Minister M K Stalin, PM Modi, and other leaders have responded, with investigations and medical aid underway for the injured.

title: Canada woos US H-1B holders: PM Carney says he will soon roll out an offer
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney announced plans to attract skilled foreign workers, particularly those to be impacted by the US's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee. Recognizing these individuals as enterprising, Canada aims to capitalize on this opportunity. Indians already form Canada's largest immigrant group, with thousands becoming permanent residents and citizens annually.

title: Another controversy! Suryakumar refuses photoshoot with Pakistan captain
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha addressed Suryakumar Yadav's reported absence from the pre-final photoshoot, stating India's team can decide their attendance. Agha stressed Pakistan's unwavering focus on cricket and winning the Asia Cup final against India on September 28. He admitted past mistakes in high-pressure India-Pakistan encounters, aiming to minimise errors for their crucial third title attempt.

title: Kobe‚Äôs daughter Natalia shines with elegance at Emporio Armani Milan 2026
content: Natalia Bryant, 22, celebrated Emporio Armani's spring 2026 collection in Milan with a striking makeup-free look, showcasing her natural beauty. The rising model, who recently graduated, is also making waves in Nike's new Kobe 3 Protro "Halo" campaign alongside Jalen Brunson, further cementing her growing presence in fashion and endorsements.

title: 'Won war? Enjoy destroyed runways and burnt-out hangars': India mocks Pak at UN
content: India sharply rebuked Pakistan at the UN, dismissing its victory claims in a recent war and demanding an end to terror sponsorship. New Delhi reminded the UN of Pakistan's history of sheltering terrorists like Osama bin Laden and its role in attacks, asserting accountability for both terrorists and their patrons, while rejecting third-party mediation.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan captain's big comment on handshake row; 'Inshallah, you'll see'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha addressed the handshake controversy ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 final against arch-rivals India. He criticized India captain Suryakumar Yadav's refusal to shake hands in earlier matches, calling it a poor precedent for the sport. Despite the drama, Agha affirmed his team's focus on winning the coveted title.

title: 'Heart is shattered': Vijay on deadly stampede at his rally; says he feels 'pain and sorrow'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Stay alert: VHP to govt over AIMPLB's stir against waqf law
content: manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at the Times of India . he has covered the national education policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives . his political reportage adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact .
